page.title: 05Pugneys development (cont)
page.content: (cont. from page 4) to turn the area into a {leisure area} and a{nature reserve.} People are already (July 1985) using the large lake for water skiing and wind surfing, though this is illegal because it is not yet controlled by the Council. Water sports enthusiasts have ignored fences. Trees have been planted. A kind of reed called phragmites has been planted in the small lake. Birds come here for food, to breed, for protection and on migration routes. Some of the birds which use the lake are Mute Swan, Canada Goose, Grebe, Coot and Mallard. Rarer species seen in the area are Kingfisher, Reed Warbler, Arctic Tern and Black Throated Diver.
